All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AchievementCard
This class represents achievement cards.
AchievementCardsMessage
This message is used to send the achievement cards to the client
AchievementDeck
Class for the Achievement Deck In this deck, the board cards are the common achievements
AchievementDeckDrawInvalidMessage
This message is used to inform the client that the draw from the achievement deck is invalid
AchievementFrontFace
This is the class for the front face of achievement cards
Actions
Contains all the actions that can be performed by the player after the lobby
AlreadyDoneMessage
This message is used to inform the client that the action they tried to do is already done
AlreadyFinishedException
Exception thrown when a game is already finished
AlreadySetException
Exception thrown when asking to set a value that is already set
AlreadyStartedException
Exception thrown when a game is already started
Card
This is the interface for handling the cards in the game.
CardCorners
Contains all the corners of a card
CardFace
This is the interface for handling the faces of the cards in the game.
CardNotPlaceableMessage
This message is used to inform the client that the card placement is invalid
Chat
Chat class to store messages
ChatMessage
This message is used to send a message to the chat and update the clients
ChatMessageIsEmptyMessage
This message is used to inform the client that they cannot send an empty message to the chat
ChooseSecretAchievementState
Class for the state where players choose their secret achievement
ChooseSecretCardController
This class is responsible for the logic of the scene where the player chooses the secret achievement card.
ChooseStartingCardController
This class is responsible for the logic of the scene where the player chooses the starting card face.
ChooseStartingCardState
Class for the state where players choose their starting card
CLI
This class is responsible for the user interface logic of the command line interface of the client side of the application.
ClientConnectionHandler
This interface is used to send messages to the server and execute messages received from the server.
ClientConnectionHandlerRMI
This class handles the connection between the client and the server using RMI.
ClientConnectionHandlerSOCKET
This class handles the connection between the client and the server using Socket.
ClientController
This interface is the controller for the client side of the application.
ClientControllerInstance
Implementation of the ClientController interface.
ClientHandler
This class is used to represent socket clients in the server.
ClientReceiver
This class is responsible for receiving messages from the server and executing them on a socket connection.
ClientSender
This class is responsible for sending messages to the server on a socket client.
CLIState
This interface is used to represent the state of the CLI.
Color
Contains all the colors of the players
ColorNotYetSetMessage
This message is used to inform the client that he needs to set his color before doing what he tried to do
ColorReadySceneController
This class is responsible for the logic of the scene where the player chooses the color and sets ready.
Controller
This interface is used to represent the controller of the server.
ControllerInstance
This is the implementation of the controller interface.
CornerCardFace
This class is the one from which all the corner card faces inherit.
Deck<T>
This class represents the deck of cards as viewed by the client.
Deckable
Interface for the decks
DeckPosition
Contains the positions of a deck.
Decks
Contains all the decks in the game
DisconnectionTimer
This class is used to manage the timer for the disconnection of a player.
DrawCardMessage
This message is used to draw a card from a deck and to give the drawn card to the client who drew it
DrawCardState
Class for the state where players draw cards
EmptyCardFace
This is the class from which all card faces inherit.
EmptyDeckMessage
Message to inform the client that the deck he is trying to draw from, in the position he is trying to draw from, is empty
EndGamePhaseMessage
This message is used to inform the client that the end game phase has started
Face
Contains the faces of a card
GameAlreadyFinishedMessage
Message to inform the client that he cannot do what he tried to do because the game has already finished
GameAlreadyStartedMessage
Message to inform the client that he cannot do what he tried to do because the game has already started
GameModel
Interface for the game model.
GameModelInstance
Implementation of the GameModel interface
GameNotYetStartedMessage
Message to inform the client that he cannot do what he tried to do because the game hasn't yet started
GameState
This class represents the state of the CLI when the game is ongoing
GameState
Contains all the possible states of the game
GeneralClientConnectionHandler
This class is the endpoint for managing the connection to the server.
GeneralServerConnectionHandler
This class is the endpoint for managing the connections to the clients.
GoldCard
This class represents gold cards.
GoldDeck
Class for the Gold cards Deck
GoldFrontFace
This class represents the front face of gold cards
Graph
Class that represents a graph of cards
GUI
This class is responsible for the graphical user interface logic of the client side of the application.
IncorrectDeckPositionException
Exception thrown when trying to use DECK as a board position
InitialHandMessage
Message to send the client their initial hand
InvalidCardMessage
Message to inform the client that the card he has selected is invalid.
InvalidMoveException
Exception thrown when a move is invalid
InvalidNameMessage
Message to inform the client that the name he tried to use has already been taken
JoinSceneController
This class is responsible for the logic of the scene where the player joins the server.
JoinState
This state is used to ask the user to join a server
LeaderboardMessage
Message to send the client the leaderboard
LeaderboardState
CLI state for the leaderboard
LeaderboardState
Class for the state where the leaderboard is shown
LoadGameLobbyState
Class for the state where the saved game lobby is
LobbyPlayersMessage
Message to send the client the info of the players in the lobby.
LobbyState
Class for the state where the lobby is
main
Main class of the game
Main
Main class of the server
MainBoardSceneController
This class is responsible for the logic of the main board scene
MainCLI
This class is responsible for starting the CLI.
MainGUI
This class is responsible for starting the GUI.
Manuscript
Class that represents the manuscript
Message
This class is used to represent messages
MissingInfoException
Exception thrown when a required data is missing
NameNotYetSetMessage
Message to inform the client that he needs to set his name before he can play
NameReadySceneController
This class is responsible for the logic of the scene where the player chooses the name and sets ready (in order to reconnect to a game).
NetworkSceneController
This class is responsible for the logic of the scene where the player chooses the connection method.
NetworkState
This state is used to ask the user to choose the network mode
NewPlayerMessage
Message to inform the client that a new player has joined the game
NewTurnMessage
Message to inform the client that a new turn has started
NotYetGivenCardMessage
Message to inform the client that he still needs to receive one or more cards to do what he wants
NotYetStartedException
Exception thrown when a game is not yet started
NotYourTurnMessage
Message to inform the client that it is not his turn, so he cannot do what he tried to do
OnBoardCard
This class is responsible for the visualization of the card on the screen.
OtherPlayerDrawCardMessage
Message to inform the client that another player has drawn a card
OtherPlayerInitialHandMessage
Message to inform the client that another player has received his initial hand
OtherPlayerPlayCardMessage
Message to inform the client that a player has placed a card on the board
OtherPlayerReconnectionMessage
Message to inform the client that another player has reconnected
OtherPlayerTab
This class is responsible for the visualization of the other player's manuscript.
PingPong
This class is responsible for sending ping messages to all RMI clients every 5 seconds.
PingServer
This class is used to periodically ping the server every 5 seconds.
PlaceCardState
Class for the state where players place their cards
PlayCardMessage
Message to ask the server to place a card
Player
This class represents the player as viewed by the client.
Player
Interface for a player
PlayerAlreadyPlayingMessage
Message to inform the client that the player with the name he tried to reconnect to is already playing
PlayerColorMessage
Message to ask the server to set the color and to notify the client that a player has set his color
PlayerDisconnectedMessage
Message to inform the client that a player has disconnected
PlayerInstance
Implementation of the Player interface
PlayerNameMessage
Message to ask the server to add a player with a certain name and to notify the client if the name has been set correctly
PlayerNotFoundByNameException
Exception thrown when trying to retrieve a player by name and the player is not found
PlayerNotFoundMessage
Message to inform the client that a player does not exist.
PlayerNotInAnyServerConnectionHandlerException
Exception thrown when a player is not in any server connection handler (i.e. disconnected)
PlayerOrderMessage
Message to inform the client of the order of the players
ReadyStatusMessage
Message to ask the server to set a player as ready or not ready and to notify the clients that a player is ready or not ready
ReconnectionMessage
Message to ask the server to reconnect and to notify the reconnecting client with the game data
ReconnectionNameMessage
Message to inform the client that a player has reconnected
RegularBackFace
This class represents the back face of gold and resource cards
RemovedPlayerMessage
Message to inform the client that a player has been removed
ResourceCard
This class represents resource cards.
ResourceDeck
Class for the Resource cards Deck
ResourceFrontFace
This class represents the front face of resource cards.
SavedGameMessage
Message to ask the server to join a saved game and to notify the client with the game data
SceneController
Abstract class for SceneController, which contains the scene logic
SceneName
This enum contains the names of the scenes.
SecretCardChoiceState
This class represents the state of the game where the player has to choose the secret card.
ServerConnectionHandler
This interface is used to handle all clients connection of a certain type.
ServerConnectionHandlerRMI
This class handles the connection between the server and the clients using RMI
ServerConnectionHandlerSOCKET
This class handles the connection between the server and the clients using sockets
ServerReceiver
This class is used to receive messages from a single socket client
ServerSender
This class is used to send messages to a single socket client
ServerState
This interface is used to handle the state of the server.
SetColorState
This class represents the state of the game where the player has to set his color and ready status.
SetNameState
This class represents the lobby state of the game.
SetSecretCardMessage
Message to ask the server to set a player's secret card and to notify the clients that a player's secret card has been set
SetStartingCardMessage
Message to ask the server to set a player's starting card and to notify the clients that a player's starting card has been set
StartGameMessage
Message to send the client the starting deck data
StartingCard
This class represents starting cards.
StartingCardChoiceState
This class represents the state of the game where the player has to choose the starting card.
StartingCardsMessage
Message to send the client his starting card
StartingFrontFace
This class represents the front face of starting cards
Symbol
Contains all the symbols found in cards
ToClientMessage
This interface is used to define the execution of a message that is sent to the clients
ToDoFirstMessage
Message to inform the client that he has to do something before doing what he tried to do
TooFewElementsException
Exception thrown when there are too few elements to do an action.
TooManyElementsException
Exception thrown when there are too many elements to do an action.
TooManyPlayersException
Exception thrown when there are too many players
TooManyPlayersMessage
Message to inform the client that there are too many players in the game, so he cannot join
ToServerMessage
This interface is used to define the execution of a message that is sent to the server
UI
This interface is responsible for the user interface logic of the client side of the application.
WaitingSceneController
Class for the Waiting Scene Controller, which does nothing
